author: Bob Albright
title: Governor’s stays perfect
text:
Governor’s stays perfect Bob Albright Sunday, October 25, 2015 comments Tweet Brendan Jordan’s 28-yard field goal with just 13 seconds left kept Governor’s Academy unbeaten as the host team held off St. Sebastian’s , 38-35, in a wild Independent School League affair yesterday in Byfield.
Tailback Cam Macri scored four times for the Governors (5-0), who led 21-20 at the half. Trailing 35-27 late in the game, St. Seb’s quarterback Tommy Seidl connected with Brendan McKenzie to make it a two-point game, and then went airborne on the conversion to tie it for the Arrows (3-2).
With the game deadlocked with just 30 seconds to go, Governors quarterback Seth Harrell somehow found a double-covered Zach Coffey from midfield all the way down to the 11 to set up Jordan’s heroics. With the sun rapidly fading, the sophomore from Rhode Island coolly spit the uprights.
In other gridiron action:
Austin Burton completed 30-of-44 passes for 456 yards and five touchdowns, while adding 50 rushing yards and a TD as Newton South (6-1) outscored Waltham , 50-31, in the Dual County Large. Anthony DeNitto caught 13 passes for 315 yards and four scores for the Lions.
Bryce Smith picked off a pair of passes and also caught a TD pass as Sharon (3-4) rallied from an early 14-point deficit to upset Canton , 30-14, in the Hockomock Davenport.
In a Northeastern South game, Jaidon Brown recorded a pick-six and a 54-yard touchdown run to power Winthrop (3-4) past Swampscott , 36-6.
In the Commonwealth Athletic Conference Large, Albert Villa rushed for two touchdowns, leading Greater Lawrence (5-2) to a 32-27 victory over Shawsheen . . . . Paul Lazzaro scored all four touchdowns for Essex Tech (4-3) in a 28-0 win over Whittier .
In a Commonwealth Athletic Conference Small game, Eli Bryant had a pair of touchdown catches and rushed for a third score as Greater Lowell (5-2) defeated Minuteman , 33-8.
In a Commonwealth Athletic Conference cross-over game, Steffan Gravely finished with 158 yards and a touchdown, and Devin Phean recorded 13 tackles as Lynn Tech (4-3) downed Northeast , 20-14, in double overtime.
Zachary Araujo ran for 101 yards and two scores as Southeastern (2-5) defeated Tri-County , 46-26, in Mayflower Large action.
In the Mayflower Small, Kyle Johnson carried the ball 27 times for 206 yards and five touchdowns as Upper Cape (5-2) defeated South Shore , 32-12.
Mike Silva ran for 150 yards and five touchdowns as Milton Academy (4-1) rolled to a 45-7 victory over Belmont Hill in the Independent School League. . . . John Beatty finished with 111 yards and three touchdowns on 19 carries as Groton (3-0) defeated Thayer , 27-18.
Ian Ostberg put on a passing exhibition, throwing for 401 yards and six touchdowns as Williston-Northampton (4-1) defeated Wilbraham & Monson , 46-21, in the Colonial League. Jake Ross was his favorite target, catching 12 passes for 321 yards and three touchdowns.
In an Evergreen League clash, freshman Tyrell Wiggins ran for 130 yards and two touchdowns as Dexter (2-3) edged Hyde (Maine), 36-28. . . . Tristan Moulton rushed for two scores and Henry Bechok threw a touchdown pass to Alex Marshall as Proctor (4-1) defeated Hebron , 21-0.
Travis Bounsy scored three touchdowns as Pentucket (7-0) rolled to a 47-7 nonleague win over Coyle & Cassidy . . . . Travis Demby had two punt returns for touchdowns and also rushed for a score, while Owen Wilson collected eight tackles and two picks as Nantucket (7-0) took down Cape Cod Tech , 49-6.
Boys soccer
In a nonleague matchup, Brian Carney scored twice as Braintree (14-2-3) defeated Bridgewater-Raynham , 4-1. . . . Manny Pestana netted the game-winning goal for BC High (9-6-1) in a 3-0 victory over Hingham . . . . Elijah Elmore had a hat trick and an assist Brookline (10-3-3) took a 6-1 win over Newton South .
Girls soccer
For only the second time in school history, St. Clement (8-7-2) qualified for the postseason with a 5-0 win over nonleague opponent Cristo Rey .
Field hockey
Kate Swanson recorded two goals for Thayer Academy (4-8) in a 3-0 victory against Lawrence Academy in the Independent School League.
Dan Venura, Kevin Barrucci, David Pollard, Brian Roach and Marcello Rossetti contributed to this report.
